page.title: 17Services in rural Cheshire.
page.content: The only shop & post office in the area will be at Saighton,when the Hatton Heath one closes in late 1985, on the owner's retirement.It serves mainly local people with tinned food, cigarettes,sweets & other groceries but there is some trade from vehicles on the A41 road. There is a post box outside,which will stay & other boxes (& telephone boxes) are at Gatesheath & Milners Heath with collections twice a day.There is a daily postal delivery by van from Chester.People also shop in Chester,Waverton & Tattenhall & go to church in the last 2 of these or Bruera.A library van comes every 2 weeks to Gatesheath & Hatton Heath. There is electricity but no gas,refuse is collected weekly & along the A41 places have main sewers but others eg. Golborne Manor need sceptic tanks.At Hatton Heath is a fire hydrant.
